definition: to identify clearly/to make sure of/to believe firmly
to recognize/to know/to admit
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
accurate/standard/definitely/certainly/about to become (bride, son-in-law etc)/quasi-/para-

sentences.english: The beginning of wisdom is to call things by their rightful names.
sentences.chinese: 公正的认准每件事物是智慧的开端。

sentences.english: Adults always know and stick to one thing.
sentences.chinese: 大人们总是知道一件事，就认准一件事。

sentences.english: So when choosing the best look for the brand of car interior.
sentences.chinese: 所以在选择汽车内饰的时候最好认准大品牌。

sentences.english: Please remember the sign of the Minlongda brand, and be ware of imitations .
sentences.chinese: 承蒙惠顾，请认准闽龙达商标标志，谨防假冒。

sentences.english: Sorrow makes us go slower and more considerately , and introspect our motives and dispositions.
sentences.chinese: 忧愁也使我们不急躁，认准动机和目标。

sentences.english: Chinese Mu Ou the north, the country to find the valve Kay, look for the "National Kai" label.
sentences.chinese: 中国慕瓯北，阀门找国凯，请认准“国凯”的商标。

sentences.english: Just focus on the direction you need to take.
sentences.chinese: 只要你专注你认准的方向。

sentences.english: I believethefirst test of truly great man is his humility.
sentences.chinese: 我认为认准一个大丈夫的首要测试就是他的谦逊。

definition: to observe and make sure/to check
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course

definition: obstinate/opinionated
to keep one's eyes open (idiom)/to be on one's guard/to be clear-eyed
to stubbornly insist on one's own ideas (idiom)

definition: concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
stubborn/inflexible/one-track minded
cautious/careful/prudent
to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly

definition: to see clearly/to recognize/to realize
to be taken advantage of
see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
certain/confident (of some outcome)/calm and unhurried
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
